title: Democratic Group Targets Local Races in Bid to Beat Trump
text:
The city council race in the beachfront town of Rockledge, Fla., isn’t typically on the target board for a major Democratic super PAC. But this fall, voters weighing their choices for two council seats in the city of about 28,000 are seeing a raft of Facebook, YouTube and Hulu ads funded by the deep-pocketed Priorities USA.

The ads, some of which feature singing, Muppet-like characters, are part of a $4 million strategy that Priorities USA hopes will help a Democratic challenger defeat President Trump next year. They don’t...
description: Priorities USA’s ads urging participation in local races have rolled out over the past few months in three states that are expected to be presidential battlegrounds: Michigan, Pennsylvania and Florida.
